articles.author: CALVIN WOODWARD
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The sound you might have heard after the presidential debate this past week was of voters falling between a rock and a hard place.
articles.title: Despair in the air: For many voters, the Biden-Trump debate means a tough choice just got tougher

articles.author: JOSH BOAK and STEVE PEOPLES
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Joe Biden is looking to recapture his mojo and reassure donors at a Saturday fundraiser that he is fully up to the challenge of beating Donald Trump.
articles.title: Biden is making appeals to donors as concerns persist over his presidential debate performance

articles.author: ADRIANA GOMEZ LICON
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — As Donald Trump narrows his options for a potential running mate, two politicians known to be on his list are from Florida, leaving open a scenario where his vice presidential nominee would have to move if the Republican ticket wins.
articles.title: The VP race's Florida question: Would Rubio or Donalds have to move if Trump picks either of them?

articles.author: MARK SHERMAN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — In the last 10 days of June, on a frenetic pace of its own making, the Supreme Court touched a wide swath of American society in a torrent of decisions on abortion, guns, the environment, health, the opioid crisis, securities fraud and homelessness.
articles.title: The Supreme Court nears the end of another momentous term. A decision on Trump's immunity looms

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER and AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — U.S., European and Arab mediators are pressing to keep stepped-up cross-border attacks between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah militants from spiraling into a wider Middle East war that the world has feared for months.
articles.title: US and Europe warn Lebanon's Hezbollah to ease strikes on Israel and back off from wider Mideast war

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — About a year and a half ago, a lawyer for Julian Assange presented federal prosecutors in Virginia with a longshot request: Dismiss the case against the WikiLeaks founder.
articles.title: The Saipan surprise: How delicate talks led to the unlikely end of Julian Assange's 12-year saga

articles.author: LISA MASCARO
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — In the first presidential debate, Republican Donald Trump skimmed over the Jan.
articles.title: Jan. 6 shadows the 2024 campaign, but not on the debate stage. That alarms democracy advocates

articles.author: HOLLY MEYER and PETER SMITH
articles.description: Christians and Jews believe in the Ten Commandments — just not necessarily the version that will hang in every public school and state-funded college classroom in Louisiana.
articles.title: Ten Commandments. Multiple variations. Why the Louisiana law raises preferential treatment concerns

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Slowly but steadily this summer, Russian troops are forging through Ukraine's outgunned and undermanned defenses in a relentless onslaught, prompting the West to push for new weapons and strategies to shore up Kyiv.
articles.title: Russia presses its offensive in Ukraine and issues new threats as the West tries to blunt the push

articles.author: DÁNICA COTO
articles.description: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico (AP) — Tropical Storm Beryl chugged toward the southeast Caribbean on Saturday as forecasters warned it was expected to strengthen into a dangerous major hurricane before reaching Barbados late Sunday.
articles.title: Tropical Storm Beryl forecast to become a major hurricane as it approaches the southeast Caribbean
